content:
For a project focused on Data Science Pipelines and Results, I used two LLMs to "informalize" theorem names and statements from Lean (mathlib) and Isabelle (archive of formal proofs). I then compared how similar the output was when prompted with just the name, or just the statement, to measure "how much data is contained in a theorem name". Of note, theorem names from Lean "contained more content" than those from Isabelle, while theorem statements (the symbolic statement) from Isabelle "contained more content" than those from Lean.

While this for a data science capstone project, I would like to potential write up the results for a general audience.

I don't know if/where I could considering sharing my pipeline and results. Any suggestions?
Hey :wave: This sounds like very useful information to record somewhere, I agree. Do you know about the Lean community blog? That could be a good fit
I did not know about it. I'm taking a look at it now. Lots of good stuff.
William Cocke has marked this topic as resolved.
